Isaiah or Isaias__27.1:
In that day the Lord with his hard, and great, and strong sword shall visit<u>
                leviathan
               </u>the bar serpent, and leviathan the crooked serpent, and shall slay the whale that is in the sea.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.2:
In that day there shall be singing to<u>
                the vineyard
               </u>of pure wine.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.3:
I am the Lord that keep it,<u>
                I will suddenly give it drink
               </u>: lest any hurt come to it, I keep it night and day.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.4:
There is<u>
                no indignation in me
               </u>: who shall make me a thorn and a brier in battle: shall march against it, shall I set it on fire together?
Isaiah or Isaias__27.5: Or rather shall it take hold of my strength, shall it make peace with me, shall it make peace with me?
Isaiah or Isaias__27.6:
<u>
                When they shall rush in
               </u>unto Jacob, Israel shall blossom and bud, and they shall fill the face of the world with seed.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.7:
<u>
                Hath he struck him
               </u>according to the stroke of him that struck him? or is he slain, as he killed them that were slain by him?
Isaiah or Isaias__27.8:
In measure against measure,<u>
                when it shall be cast off
               </u>, thou shalt judge it.<u>
                He hath meditated
               </u>with his severe spirit in the day of heat.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.9:
Therefore upon this shall the iniquity<u>
                of the house of Jacob
               </u>be forgiven: and this is all the fruit, that the sin thereof should be taken away, when he shall have made all the stones of the altar, as burnt stones broken in pieces, the groves and temples shall not stand.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.10:
For<u>
                the strong city
               </u>shall be desolate, the beautiful city shall be forsaken, and shall be left as a wilderness: there the calf shall feed, and there shall he lie down, and shall consume its branches.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.11: Its harvest shall be destroyed with drought, women shall come and teach it: for it is not a wise people, therefore he that made it, shall not have mercy on it: and he that formed it, shall not spare it.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.12: And it shall come to pass, that in that day the Lord will strike from the channel of the river even to the torrent of Egypt, and you shall be gathered together one by one, O ye children of Israel.
Isaiah or Isaias__27.13:
And it shall come to pass, that in that day a noise shall be made with<u>
                a great trumpet
               </u>, and they that were lost, shall come from the land of the Assyrians, and they that were outcasts in the land of Egypt, and they shall adore the Lord in the holy mount in Jerusalem.
